content: How can I extract the last 10 elements from a Python list if the length of the list is greater than 10? I've tried using new_list = [(len(my_list) - 10):] but it's not working. Any suggestions are appreciated.

To extract the last 10 elements from a Python list, you can use slicing. The syntax you attempted has a small error. Here's the correct way to do it:

```python
# Assuming my_list is your original list
new_list = my_list[-10:]
```

This code will give you a new list `new_list` containing the last 10 elements of `my_list`, but only if the length of `my_list` is greater than or equal to 10. If `my_list` is shorter than 10 elements, it will simply return the entire list.
